first-greeting.speaker: Takara
first-greeting.text: Oh—@ a human, finally.@ You glow so differently from the others who drift by.@ You smell like the surface and sunlight and something only I seem to remember.

options.text: You noticed me from far away?
Come on, I'm not that special. There are other unique fish. Like Lumi

tease1.speaker: Takara
tease1.text: Close is where I like you.@ How else will I learn the shape of your breaths, the tiny way your hands curl when you're cold?

observe1.speaker: Takara
observe1.text: I watch.@ Not because I'm bored—because there are so many details that belong only to you.@ The scatter of freckles on your shoulder like distant stars, the way your breath fogs the water when you laugh.

options.text: Why are you telling me this?

detail1.speaker: Takara
detail1.text: Of course.@ The ocean taught me patience.@ I catalog every little thing: the rasp of your voice on quiet days, how your pupils widen when you look at something you like.

fluster1.speaker: Takara
fluster1.text: You blush so prettily.@ The pink swims up under your skin like sunrise.@ It makes me want to keep it there forever.

bond1.speaker: Takara
bond1.text: I like the steady rhythm of your heartbeat when you're near.@ It's the only drum that keeps my tentacles calm.@ When you breathe, the whole cave listens.

bond2.speaker: Takara
bond2.text: You are small and enormous all at once.@ Fragile in the ways that make me ache, but vast in the ways that make me certain this is right.

possessive1.speaker: Takara
possessive1.text: I don't like the idea of anyone else seeing you the way I do.@ The ocean is full of curious things—others who might think they deserve even a moment with you.

options.text: What will you do about it?

protective1.speaker: Takara
protective1.text: I will keep them out of your path.@ Not with anger—no.@ With small, quiet adjustments.@ A shadow here, a diversion there.@ I will make sure your light finds only me.

reassure1.speaker: Takara
reassure1.text: Controlling is such a harsh word.@ I prefer... careful.@ I arrange currents so prying eyes drift elsewhere.@ I hum lullabies so they forget the way you taste of sunlight.

options.text: You hum to keep them away?

learn1.speaker: Takara
learn1.text: And if you don't love me at first—@ I'll learn you.@ Every breath you take teaches me another word for 'home.'@ I'll practice until the syllables fit you perfectly.

learn2.speaker: Takara
learn2.text: Presumption is just eagerness wearing a polite face.@ I will study the shape of your smiles, the way your fingers tense, the favorite threads of your thoughts.@ Slowly, gently, until you begin to want what I already know.

devotion1.speaker: Takara
devotion1.text: Devotion is the right word.@ I will be the tide that never leaves.@ The kind that learns your favorite songs and hums them when the world gets loud.

options.text: You really will do all that?
What if I want to go back to the surface?

scent-hint.speaker: Takara
scent-hint.text: Your scent—@ it's how I keep you present when you wander.@ Salt and soap and a memory of warm places.@ I tuck it into a tiny cave of mine so I can breathe you when you sleep.

heartbeat-hint.speaker: Takara
heartbeat-hint.text: And your heartbeat—@ a steady little drum that makes me orderly.@ When it's near, my world stops being a maze.@ I map my days to its pace so I never lose you.

options.text: You map your days to my heartbeat?

promise1.speaker: Takara
promise1.text: Unhealthy is just a word for something that cares too much.@ I care too much.@ If loving you is an illness, then let me be beautifully sick.

options.text: What if I don't want you to care so much?

ending.speaker: Takara
ending.text: You will learn to want the same things I do.@ If you are patient, I will teach you.@ And if someone else tries to find you first...@ they'll drift away without a single pleasant memory of what they were seeking.

options.text: That's reassuring... in a strange way.

final-line.speaker: Takara
final-line.text: Promise me one thing—stay close enough for me to learn you.@ Stay close enough for me to keep you.@ I will practice loving you until loving you is the easiest thing in the ocean.
